message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to offer you this amazing product. It's a great opportunity to get your hands on something truly unique. I'm willing to sell it to you for $90.
I'm really interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $75. Would you be willing to meet me at that price?

Thank you for your offer, Bob. I appreciate your interest in the product. However, I'm not willing to go as low as $75. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer it to you for $82.50. It's a great deal, and I think you'll really enjoy the product.
I'm still a bit hesitant about the price. I was thinking more along the lines of $77.50. Would you be willing to meet me at that price?

I understand you're still a bit hesitant, Bob. I'm willing to compromise further. I'll meet you at $80, but that's as low as I can go. It's still a great deal, and I think you'll really enjoy the product.
I think we're getting close, but I'm still not willing to pay the full $80. I'll meet you halfway again, so I'll offer $79. Would you be willing to accept that?
I'm getting close to accepting, Bob, but I still need to make a bit more profit. I'll meet you at $79.50. It's the last offer I'm willing to make.
I'm not willing to go up to $79.50. I'll meet you at $78.50, and that's my final offer. I'm not interested in going any higher than that.
I understand you're firm on your offer, Bob, but I'm not willing to accept $78.50. I'll meet you at $79.00, and that's my final offer. It's the best I can do.
I'm not willing to pay $79. I'll meet you at $78, and that's my final offer. If you're not willing to accept that, I'll have to consider buying from John for $80.
